name: Clematis erecta
Relationship: Compare: CLEMATIS VITALBA (varicose and other ulcers); SIL.; STAPH.; PETROL.; OLEAND.; SARSAP.; CANTH.; PHOS-AC.; PULSAT.Antidotes: BRYON.; CAMPH.

Eyes: Heat in eyes and SENSITIVE TO AIR; must close them
Chronic blepharitis, with sore and swollen meibomian glands
Pustular conjunctivitis, with tinea capitis; eyes inflamed and protruding
Stomach: After eating, weakness in all limbs and pulsation in arteries
Head: Boring pain in temples
CONFUSED FEELING; BETTER IN OPEN AIR
Eruption on occiput at base of hair, moist, pustular sensitive, itching
Face: White blisters on face and nose, as if burned by sun
Swelling of submaxillary glands, with hard tubercles; throbbing, aggravated on being touched
Pain in right side of face to eye, ear and temple; better, holding cold water in mouth
ACHE; WORSE, AT NIGHT AND FROM TOBACCO
Skin: Itches terribly; worse, washing in cold water; worse face and hands and SCALP AROUND OCCIPUT
GLANDS hot, painful, SWOLLEN; worse inguinal glands
Glandular induration and tumors of breast
Male: Violent erections with stitches in urethra
Testicles hang heavy or retracted, with pain along spermatic cord; worse, right side
Tingling in urethra lasting some time after urinating
Frequent, scanty urination; burning at orifice
Inability to pass all the urine; dribbling after urinating
Pain worse at night, pain along the spermatic cord

details: Scrofulous, rheumatic, gonorrheal, and syphilitic patients. Acts especially on skin, GLANDS and genitourinary organs, especially testicles. A remedy of much importance in disturbances of sleep, and neuralgic PAINS in various parts. Many of these pains are relieved by perspiration. Muscles relaxed or twitching. Great emaciation. GREAT SLEEPINESS. Distant pulsation in whole body.
